org.mini2Dx.core.input

Interface GamePad

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LibgdxAdvancedGamePad, LibgdxGamePad

    public interface GamePad
    Common interface for gamepads/controllers/joysticks/etc.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getGamePadType

        GamePadType getGamePadType()
        Returns the GamePadType
        Returns:
        GamePadType.UNKNOWN if unknown

      • getInstanceId

        java.lang.String getInstanceId()
        Returns the ID for this GamePad. When supported by the driver, if multiple gamepads are connected each will have a unique instance id. Otherwise, this will fallback for to the name of the device returned by the driver. If a gamepad is unplugged and reconnected, it will have the same ID.
        Returns:
        The unique ID when possible, otherwise the generic ID

      • getModelInfo

        java.lang.String getModelInfo()
        Returns the model information present by the hardware/driver (e.g. Xbox One Wireless Controller)
        Returns:

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns if this GamePad is connected
        Returns:
        False if it has been disconnected/unplugged

      • isPlayerIndicesSupported

        boolean isPlayerIndicesSupported()
        Returns if this game pad supports assigning player numbers to it
        Returns:
        True if supported

      • getPlayerIndex

        int getPlayerIndex()
        Returns the player assigned to this gamepad
        Returns:
        -1 if unassigned

      • setPlayerIndex

        void setPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
        Sets the player assigned to this gamepad
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - -1 if unassigned

      • isVibrateSupported

        boolean isVibrateSupported()
        Returns if this gamepad has vibrate/rumble functionality
        Returns:
        True if supported

      • isVibrating

        boolean isVibrating()
        Returns if this gamepad is currently vibrating/rumbling
        Returns:
        True if vibrating/rumbling

      • getVibrationStrength

        float getVibrationStrength()
        Returns the strength of the vibration/rumble
        Returns:
        -1f if not vibrating/rumbling

      • startVibration

        void startVibration(float strength)
        Starts vibrating/rumbling the gamepad
        Parameters:
        strength - A value between 0f and 1f

      • stopVibration

        void stopVibration()
        Stops the vibrating/rumbling of the gamepad

      • isButtonDown

        boolean isButtonDown(int buttonCode)
        Returns if a specific button is currently pressed down
        Parameters:
        buttonCode - The button code (Note: these may vary per platform)
        Returns:
        True if pressed down

      • isButtonUp

        boolean isButtonUp(int buttonCode)
        Returns if a specific button is currently released (not pressed down)
        Parameters:
        buttonCode - The button code (Note: these may vary per platform)
        Returns:
        True if released (not pressed down)

      • getAxis

        float getAxis(int axisCode)
        Returns the current value of an axis
        Parameters:
        axisCode - The axis code (Note: these may vary per platform)
        Returns:
        The value between -1.0f and 1.0f

      • getPov

        PovState getPov(int povCode)
        Returns the current value of a PoV (Dpad)
        Parameters:
        povCode - The PoV code (Note: these may vary per platform)
        Returns:
        The current PovState

      • isAccelerometerSupported

        boolean isAccelerometerSupported()
        Returns if this gamepad has accelerometer functionality
        Returns:
        True if supported

      • getAccelerometer

        org.mini2Dx.gdx.math.Vector3 getAccelerometer(int accelerometerCode)
        Returns the current accelerometer value
        Parameters:
        accelerometerCode - The accelerometer code (Note: these may vary per platform)
        Returns:
        The acceleromter value on 3 axis in m/s^2

      • getAccelerometerSensitivity

        float getAccelerometerSensitivity()
        Returns the accelerometer sensitivity
        Returns:
        The sensitivity where 0.0 is lowest, 1.0 is highest

      • setAccelerometerSensitivity

        void setAccelerometerSensitivity(float sensitivity)
        Sets the accelerometer sensitivity
        Parameters:
        sensitivity - The sensitivity where 0.0 is lowest, 1.0 is highest

      • addListener

        void addListener(GamePadListener listener)
        Adds a GamePadListener to listen to state changes
        Parameters:
        listener - The GamePadListener to add

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(GamePadListener listener)
        Removes a GamePadListener
        Parameters:
        listener - The GamePadListener to remove
